meanings.definition: Situated behind or on the side of the axis.
meanings.sent1: The postaxial position of the satellite made it hard to detect.
meanings.sent2: The postaxial location of the tree provided shade in the afternoon.
meanings.sent3: The postaxial placement of the chair caused a funny mix-up in the seating arrangement.
meanings.sent4: Her postaxial decision to sit at the back of the class gave her a different perspective.
meanings.sent5: The postaxial shadow of the building stretched across the street.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the side of the body opposite the thumb.
meanings.sent1: The postaxial side of the hand is where the pinky finger is.
meanings.sent2: She felt a tickle on her postaxial toe, which made her giggle.
meanings.sent3: His postaxial ear was always colder than the rest of his body.
meanings.sent4: The postaxial foot of the table kept wobbling, making it hard to balance.
meanings.sent5: The postaxial side of the road had more trees, providing a cooler walk.
